meanings.definition: The act of providing with gears or gearing.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic explained the gearing of the bicycle to the young boy.
meanings.sent2: The gearing in the clock needed to be oiled to function smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The gearing of the robot made it move in a funny, jerky way.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like the intricate gearing of a clock, each thought fitting precisely into place.
meanings.sent5: The gearing of the pulley system made lifting the heavy load seem effortless.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of gears in a machine.
meanings.sent1: The gearing of the engine was carefully designed for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The gearing in the old watch was a marvel of craftsmanship.
meanings.sent3: The gearing of the toy car was so intricate, it looked like a tiny puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The gearing of the lock clicked into place with a satisfying sound.
meanings.sent5: The gearing of the windmill turned the blades with precision, harnessing the power of the wind.

meanings.definition: The system of gears in a vehicle that allows it to move at different speeds.
meanings.sent1: The gearing of the car enabled it to smoothly transition between gears.
meanings.sent2: The gearing in the bicycle made it easier to pedal uphill.
meanings.sent3: The gearing of the truck seemed to have a mind of its own, shifting gears unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The gearing of the boat's engine roared to life, propelling it forward.
meanings.sent5: The gearing of the train allowed it to pick up speed as it left the station.
